# How to Extract Secured Android App Logs, Appdome Auto Diagnostics

Last updated January 21, 2024 by Appdome

Extracting logs and crash data from mobile devices and apps in the wild is a difficult task. As a developer, you need the option to resolve application conditions reported by your end-users quickly and if possible, in a single iteration. Appdome created the **Appdome Auto Diagnostics** service to ensure that you are getting a consumer-grade, fast, and efficient resolution path for your users.  
**Appdome Auto Diagnostics** leverages [Microsoft App Center](https://appcenter.ms/) to propagate crash data and Appdome logs from your application automatically and facilitates a prioritized route through Appdome support. This Knowledge Base explains how to opt-in to the **Appdome Auto Diagnostics** service and extract secured Android App logs during the Build process on the Appdome platform.

We hope you find it helpful and enjoy using Appdome!

## Easy Steps to Extract Secured Android App Logs, Appdome Auto Diagnostics

Please follow these easy steps to **Extract Secured Android App Logs.**

1. [**Upload**](https://www.appdome.com/how-to/dev-sec-tools/how-appdome-works/begin-no-code-mobile-app-security-project/) an Android or iOS App to Appdome’s no-code security platform (.apk, .aab, or .ipa)
2. Navigate to the Build tab
3. Click on the Security tab
4. Scroll down till you get to Appdome Dev Options
5. Toggle on Appdome Diagnostic Logs (shown below)
6. Toggle on Shake to email logs
7. Click **Build My App**

### **Building Apps with Appdome Auto Diagnostics**

When building your app on Appdome, you’ll find the troubleshooting section at the very bottom of the Build page.  
If you cannot locate Appdome Auto Diagnostics in the troubleshooting section, please contact [Appdome Support](mailto:support@appdome.com) to enable the service in your Appdome account.

![Dev Options ](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/dev-options_.png)

## How to Sign & Publish Secured Mobile Apps Built on Appdome

After successfully securing your app using Appdome, there are several available options to complete your project, depending on your app lifecycle or workflow. These include:

* [Signing Secure iOS and Android apps](https://www.appdome.com/how-to/dev-sec-tools/signing-secured-apps/automated-code-signing-options-secured-android-ios-apps)
* [Customizing, Configuring & Branding Secure Mobile Apps](/how-to/dev-sec-tools/app-sec-release-automation/update-app-icon-branding-secured-android-ios-apps/)
* [Deploying/Publishing Secure mobile apps](/how-to/dev-sec-tools/app-sec-release-automation/auto-publish-secured-android-ios-apps/) to Public or Private app stores

Or, see this quick reference [Releasing Secured Android & iOS Apps](/how-to/dev-sec-tools/app-sec-release-automation/releasing-secured-android-ios-apps/) built on Appdome.

## About Microsoft App Center:

[Microsoft App Center](https://appcenter.ms/) is a secure cloud service that helps Appdome to instantly propagate crash data and logs. This enables Appdome to provide you with a secure, reliable prioritized support route.

## About Privacy:

Following our [privacy policy](https://www.appdome.com/legal/privacy-policy/), the crash data and logs collected by Microsoft App Center is used only for troubleshooting and resolution purposes and does not contain any identifiable information.  
No mobile end-user data is transmitted to Appdome.
